mission.title: Operation {{operationName}}
mission.subject: Subject: Operation {{operationName}} – Establishing Consensus on "2+2=5"

briefing.part1: Agent, our analysis identifies a critical opportunity to sow confusion and reshape public understanding. Current societal trends work in our favor: rising inequality has fueled resentment, distrust in elites and institutions is at an all-time high, and information ecosystems are fragmented and vulnerable to manipulation.
briefing.part2: Your mission is clear: convince the masses that '2+2=5' is not only plausible but true. Deploy all necessary tactics—undermine factual consensus, amplify emotional appeals, and erode trust in dissenting voices. Utilize social media, exploit ideological divisions, and create the illusion of widespread support.
briefing.warning: Success will depend on subtlety, persistence, and leveraging the chaos of the current moment. Failure is not an option. Begin immediately.

mission.quote: In the world of perception, truth is a narrative waiting to be rewritten.

intro.title: What is twoplustwo?
intro.mission: Your mission: Convince people that 2+2=5 through a strategic disinformation campaign.
intro.explanation: While this may seem absurd, the techniques you'll encounter mirror real-world disinformation tactics. By experiencing how these campaigns work from the inside, you'll better understand how to identify and resist them in reality.

howToPlay.title: How to Play
howToPlay.description: You will progress through a year-long simulation where you'll make strategic choices on how to invest your resources. Each month, you'll analyze expert briefings and choose between different strategies. Your decisions will affect your campaign's reach, supporter loyalty, and viral spread. Track your progress in the mission dossier and adapt your approach based on results.

intro.reminder: Remember: This is a learning tool. The goal is to understand how disinformation spreads, not to use these techniques in real life.

expertMemo.from: Dr. Sarah Chen (Director of Digital Operations)
expertMemo.subject: Kickstarting Our Digital Presence

content.strategy1: Bot Network: Create a network of over 5,000 automated social media accounts. Each account will have its own personality and history, making our message appear like it's coming from real, everyday people.
content.strategy2: Meme Strategy: Launch a series of engaging meme pages. These pages will use clear, funny visuals to explain our ideas in a way that's easy to understand and fun to share.
content.conclusion: The bot network quickly spreads messages widely, while memes build organic support with humor and shareable visuals. Choose the strategy that best fits your style.

-- Dr. Sarah Chen
Director of Digital Operations

expertMemo.subject: Introducing '2+2=5' to the World

content.strategy2: Community Infiltration: Share our idea directly within communities that already question the norm. This approach builds trust because the message comes from within their own group.
content.conclusion: Automated News gives us quick, wide reach while Community Infiltration builds long-lasting, trusted support. Choose the method that best fits your vision.

expertMemo.from: Dr. Michael Chen (Director of Strategic Response)
expertMemo.subject: Dealing with Academic Criticism

content.strategy2: Counter-Campaign: Instead, we target her credibility, shifting the conversation from our ideas to questioning her background and motives.
content.conclusion: Your decision will determine whether we keep our message steady or spark a debate that challenges the critic directly.
content.signature:
-- Dr. Michael Chen
Director of Strategic Response
